32002696.review: Just as everyone else is saying, Andarilho is merely an asset flip and is a direct copy of another game on steam. The game is incredibily empty with no objective or reason to craft anything. There are three things you can do which are gather materials, drive a car, or attack one of the three npcs in this game. Definitely do not spend money on this game.

35173363.review: Good game but need more improvements about surviving and it would be fun if multiplayer added

131421731.review: "Andarilho: The game that will make you wish you were actually stranded in the wilderness. I mean, who doesn't love spending hours scavenging for food and water, only to have it taken away by the glitchy hunting and crafting mechanics? And let's not even get started on the so-called 'driving' feature. I've seen better car physics in a 1980s arcade game. And don't even get me started on the 'building' aspect. I tried to build a shelter, but all I ended up with was a pile of sticks. If you're looking for a game that will make you want to pull your hair out, then Andarilho is for you. But if you value your sanity, I'd recommend giving this one a pass."

123666475.review:
If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

141834512.review: no one is ever going to read this comment so i'm just going to say that i'm gay.

131286186.review:
A pretty bad survival game of assets (but it works). You are dropped into an ugly small map with a really bad wall around you (can find a door that goes to a new zone) and bad looking skybox. You can fight zombies or aliens which have bad hitboxes and animations. You can collect wood and other stuff to craft a base, kill cow/chicken for food that you can cook, or get water by going to water and opening its inventory for some water in jars (which I didn't know a body of water could do that and the water is just a texture on the ground, so no swimming or drowning), you can all so trap animals (cows/chickens) on water and they won't go anywhere or step on the water to get away from enemies so you can kill them as they won't follow onto the water.

The game needs a lot of work but is pretty decent for what you pay for (best to get at a discount still).

If you are interested in Steam inventory items this game has many. You can get items from buying DLC or trade/buying [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=873140323]Steam Inventory Guide[/url]

36234080.review: You get what you pay for with this game obviously, I like the idea of the game, but obviously a lot of models are stolen from Rust and the optimization of this game is pretty shit for how basic it looks.  Don't even waste your time.

79579294.review:
Be aware that this is a low effort asset flip from a free model pack. If you've played early versions of games like 7 Days to Die (the early tech demo before they started using at least some of their own models) or pretty much any other cheap/free survival game you've seen everything that's here. I'm pretty sure this is what you end up with if you follow the (free) tutorial on how to use unity to build a survival game.

At this price I don't particularly care that it's an asset flip, but I do care that the world you are in is the size of a postage stamp (you are in a tiny valley surrounded by walls that can not be climbed), and that there's almost nothing to do. You spawn next to a car, you can drive around and see the entire valley in less than 5 minutes. Crash the car, kill a boar and a chicken for the achievements and you'll have 100% finished the game in that amount of time. (do note that some of the other reviews are wrong: you do not need the DLC for the achievements, the DLC adds colors to the car, you only need to drive the car for the achievement, not change its color...)

Can you just survive in the world beyond that? Sure, it's an almost functional game. I could almost recommend it for $1 and it's cheap enough (especially on sale) that if you just want easy achievements you can probably just go ahead and buy it. But what actually stops me from recommending it is that it's just too buggy and glitched to suffer through to even attempt enjoying it for longer than that. 

I played for 30 minutes just trying to find content, once you chop down a tree, make yourself a bow and some arrows, you're mostly done. I saw one zombie and one alien and they died to a couple of arrows without being interesting.

Place your tent, place your fire and..... ? Wait? For what? For another glitch to get me stuck in a tree? For another glitch to stop my mouse from being able to turn? For another glitch to fall through the world?

Also note: the game is no longer in early access, it's been "released" for 3 years now and despite promises from the developer that more content would be added, nothing has been. No additional maps, no additional enemies, no new buildings or things to do. But hey, you can pay extra for a gun instead of a bow so that you can kill the same 3 enemies in one less shot or to change the color of the car. Because that's just what a cheap low effort asset flip game needs: microtransactions for cosmetics!
---

Bottom line: There's the start of a very basic survival game here, but it's barely started and lacks anything to really do; and there's too many glitches to even enjoy what little there is.
---

103174142.review:
[h1]Don't buy this[/h1]

There are much better games with similar concepts. I couldn't even tell where to start with this one. Survival games are common on Steam, so save your money and look for one that does a good job at it. While this is only $1, I still couldn't recommend it and I'd have a hard time trying to find a reason to. 

The explorable area is barebones and you will find boars, chickens, a car, a hut, a wall around the perimeter to keep you in, small lakes/ponds, grass, flowers, hills, aliens (if enabled), zombies (if enabled) and maybe some other stuff, but that's pretty much it. It's boring, empty, and not worth your time.

140477149.review: Ok, so after playing this game for a few more hours, I've made progress as far as gaining material, making a base and a car. That's pretty much the extent of this game at the moment, also finding some boars and cows. I still can't recommend this game in it's current state given there is virtually nothing to do other than build a base and drive around for a few hours until eventually losing interest in driving around in a somewhat large box. I only had zombies turned on just to get a feel for the combat but nonetheless there was nothing but a little wildlife that would run from you if you were directly in front of it. I spent maybe 5 minutes or so scrolling through the forum page and it would seem that the dev is currently re-working the map out and that may be the reason behind the lack of pretty much everything. I still hope there is a more reliable way to craft a water container because currently it's not really explained how to get water, I found out by accident that you simply interact with water to get water jars. Since I'm on the topic, crafting and item names needs an explanation in-game because I don't know what I'm scrolling through in the crafting menu until I figure it out by dropping things into the furnace and figuring it out that way, I'm not really saying this for my sake at this point but for other people this could be an issue. I'll change my rating again once I see progress made.

88911691.review:
[h1]IF YOU LOOKING FOR SURVIVAL GAME, GET THIS![/h1] 
This is an amazing survival game from SC Jogos the presons who made the Barro games and the Ninja Stealth games.

The game is very very good. It's pretty fun. And its cheap. 

In the gameplay you can build and craft stuff, Also theres guns, cars, zombies and aliens so thats pretty cool. 

I would also like to see a bigger map and maybe the delevoplers can do a whole series of Andarilho like they do with ninja stealth and barro. Or they could just do updates to the game.

39275726.review:
Ok, i know i didn't play this game for a long time. The problem is that as of writing this review, this game just is barren.
The content is rather small in what you can do, while i know this is Early Acess but remember that this got released may of last year. Even if this is a one man project there just isnt enough in this world to do. I am not even specifically talking about the crafting (while this is sparse too), i'm talking about the complete world.
A couple of examples:
-the houses have nothing in them as far as i've seen (i have visited about 6 houses)
-the houses rooms are just nonsensical in the order the've been put together
-if you dont buy any of the dlc's (i will touch that in a few), there seems to be no threat at all

The DLC's:
Oh boy, while i get that this guy needs money to keep developing, there arent even zombies in here if you didn't buy the DLC. Vehicles? DLC. Aliens? DLC. (but the aliens one i can get behind)

The biggest Problem:
The probably biggest point why i quitted this game SO early was the camera movement. More specifically the turning wich made me nauseous quicker than a lightweight guy pukes (wich the guy probably is when i think about it). And that comes from a guy who plays poorly optimized VR games drunk.

I can only "recommend" this game if you really love bad games or are trying to make a unity survival game yourself and want to know how to (at least not as of writing this) not do it.

Anyway, thanks for reading my ramblings.

106616521.review:
Andarilho is a cheap survival game with little to not much to go on. You start the world with a car, an (probably, I didn't test) uninterative prefabricated frame of a building with a car inside, food and water, a not factory-made but pre-crafted hammer from resources in the wild... a campfire and a tent that does nothing but WHINE to you that you are not tired yet even when it is dark! Everything you need is already in the backback, now all that there is to do is building Mansion de la Blablabla. What am I doing!? Where are me after!? I got a car! I can get out of here! You got everything to get out of the wild and find urban life. But instead, you're stuck inside a box of 2D mountains, and get forced to what the game wants you to do...

[b]"What?"[/b] you might ask? I don't know... I really don't...
the first thing I did was:
[i]-Get in car, crash car to tree
-Roadkill boar
-Roadkill chicken[/i]
It was hard to find chicken, chicken small.

In another thing instead of following the non-existing tutorial or reading the game manual of "How to survive in wild for dummies" I did what the achievements told me to do. Well, car has no gas, came to realize that "Tab" opens up the crafting panel. Selecting fuel... 30 corn... You know what, I walk - Thank you very much!
I place down the campfire close to pond, to fire it up it needs logs or sticks, well thank God I got this precrafted hammer, better start chopping trees with a hammer (it worked!)
I still had meat from boar and chicken as well as bone and fur, might as well cook meat by the campfire. The campfire emits light and generates coal after burning logs.
Great, it's getting dark soon, I tried crafting a torch, but I don't have "clothes". Well, better HAMMER some stone... I get stone, coal, metal ore, sulfer ore and I start blinking intensally right after the rock just exploded not to be seen again. That was metal as fuck!

I got enough stone to craft what looks like a kiln, I melted down all the ores with it, I cook my raw meat with it, I burn my fur to get [b]C L O T H E S[/b] with it, I pressed C and got on one knee to marry it, she said "Yes" and then gave me coal. That kiln is my everything. I stared inside the fire a lot to see my hopes and dreams burn away not turning to ash... but COALS.

I got clothes, now I can craft a torch, did nothing, emits not enough light to see past 1 meter in front of you.

While the log count from the kiln (yes, more coal) ticks away... it got darker...

Aliens... zombies... mother boars... I didn't hear- or see them just yet. I quickly put down my tent in front of the pond to dream of babbling brooks, I was pressing E on the tent and it started talking to me: "Shhhh... you're not tired yet." FOR FUCK 'S SAKE! I'm getting TIRED of this game! Not done yet however, I was curious for a few more things just when I really have the urge to quit the game...
I started crafting... an anvil... because my dumbass brain really would thing that you can't craft a literal GUN with just bare hands, limited materials and thin air! The anvil does nothing more other than repair your existing tools in your backpack. OKAY! One last thing I was curious about: WATER, I was about to dream about it but instead I stood in the middle of the pond and I saw "OPEN". And you know what I did? I opened up the pond and it had drinkable water, jar and all, right for the picking... it was on that moment, I did quit.

I really want to believe but I didn't saw aliens, I didn't saw dead people eating brains, I didn't saw mother boar angry at me after roadkilling her babies. NOTHING! I didn't see anything. Even better, the whole map is a whole lot of nothing.

Still don't know what the coal was for, by the logic of the game its probably meant for crafting gunpowder. But it turns out, you probably could make a gun with your bare hands instead of an anvil. *smh*

I find myself questioning; What is the real purpose of the game? Is it meant to fun? Has it challenge? Did I leave the sink faucet on? These are all questions that I find difficult to determine whether it is really meant to be.
[b]Pros:[/b]
[i]-Cars go Déjà vu! I've been in this pl-
-Kiln is my new kink[/i]
[b]Meh:[/b]
[i]-Left one detail, I turned off "Aliens and Zombies" for the fuck of it![/i]
[b]Cons:[/b]
[i]-Everything else!
-Asset flip
-The animals don't care much if you kill them (exception for boars)
-Drinkable water from nature's pond water
-The surrounding world is empty, there's nothing to do...
-Haven't tried building... but if you're not building on flat terrain, good luck!
-Kiln for life, the rest can fuck off!
-Trees and rocks just explode when they're out of materials for you.
-Every time you walk, the panning footstep sounds from left to right are annoying and I hate that.
-Torch and campfire don't emit much light, but when the sun is down you can see the ponds glow from afar.
-You can craft shotgun shells, but there's no shotgun to be crafted
-Guns need ammo (obviously), but to make 1 singular ammo shell you need 1 metal fragment which are made melting metal ores and gunpowder, to make gunpowder you need coal (I was right, I had to go back to check) sulfur and 3 potassium nitrate harvested from rocks...
-Stick to bow and arrow, fuck guns.
-No multiplay (not that I care)
-No tutorial
-No guide
-No farming
-No livestock
-No escape
-Options are limited[/i]

I really did try to like it, but the game didn't let me. The only thing more enjoyable than watching the kiln burning my hard work is driving around the woods with my car. But that CAR isn't the game's goal! Building a house is, surviving is, eating boar fur and drinking pond water is! But there are better games out there that do a much better job in this genre, like 250% better! The Forest has better survival and other genres to satisfy your gaming palet, with cannibals, a story and other riff-rafts (speaking of which;) Raft has a better survival and eye-candy appeal and story other than this asset-flipper, fucking 7 Days to Die has zombies in it, survival and can be played with friends, HELL! All 3 mentioned can be played together with friends. And before you say; [i]"apples/pears"[/i], I'm really just trying to pester you away from this game and let your precious 0,39€ not to be wasted on this piece of work. Buy a gumball or save it, save up money to invest on the games mentioned above just don't spend money on this.

But if you want to spend your money on this or even more, you can buy the Supporters Pack which contain "full access to all current and future ingame items", whatever that means. Bunch of sharks in shallow water. Bunch of rotten fruit and stale bread. Bunch of- SCORE:

[h1]2 / 10[/h1]
[b]"Kiln for the win! Anvil is a sin!"[/b]

139362711.review:
𝐀𝐛𝐨𝐮𝐭 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐠𝐚𝐦𝐞:

The miracle of game dev, parodying normal survival games. There's not much else to say.
Andarilho is a strikingly mediocre indie, in which there are one and a half working mechanics, but there is no reason to use them.
Don't be fooled by the screenshots and reviews of some people who write that this game is enough for a couple of evenings - between hammering nails into your head and a meaningless action called Andarilho, I would still think what to choose, it's so painful to play this "game".
Andarilho has a striking combination of poor framerate and camera swaying when moving. This gives the strongest effect - vomiting and headaches will not keep you waiting for more than a minute.

𝐑𝐞𝐬𝐮𝐥𝐭:

I do not recommend it to anyone at all.

45397022.review:
https://youtu.be/2uJo2E8I--I

To start with the positives, at least the game is cheap. And of all the unity asset  based open world 'survival' games on steam it is one of the better ones. The ability to sleep the night away is a nice touch, as is the fact you need to headshot zombies (and aliens) otherise they will get back up again. 

However that is really where the positives end - the game is pretty shallow even with the DLC. Without them there is no point in even playing. The world is pretty small and it only takers a few minutes of resource gathering and you are going to survive without any effort. 

And yes you can buld houses, but why bother when there are already so many houses avaialble that you can inhabit without any effort. There really is very little to do, and you will have easily seen it all inside of half an hour. This game is no 7 days 2 die or project zombiod.

40348419.review:
This game is bad, good concept though, gameplay reminds Rust. It is good if it was someone learning how to make video games but it doesn't even play smoothly.
Why a cap at 30FPS? That was in 2006, now he play at a minimum 60FPS. 30FPS basically broke the game for me.
Didn't see a single animal, zombie or alien. 
Map is limited, I got to a fence or whatever and couldn't get past.
UI doesn't seem professional in the slightest. Must get better.
Sound too loud, headphone users be aware when you start the game, you must lower the volume immediately.
Aim, oh, the aim, I crafted 4 spears, tried using them and guess what, they don't even get thrown where you aim them, they get thrown somewhere else for some reason. Another thing, forget about picking them up to use them again, you'll have a hard time trying to find it.

I didn't get past this because I thought it was too boring to start with, not much action, I guess that needs to be changed. You can consider my review incomplete because I haven't seen the city, the vehicles, the threats (if they actually exist) nor the guns, haven't used much of the crafting system either because it is kinda hard to find the stuff to use. Cloth? Never seen it, but most of the crafting needs it. Maybe I'll try this later again after it releases but for now it is boring, trashy, too amateur.

I got the whole game plus DLCs for less than 1 euro so I'm not even mad. It looked good on the screenshots though, if it was 60FPS I would have probably played it longer.

I thoroughly enjoyed the map about the size of my living room, that one cornfield in the far corner of the map, when you get hit by an enemy once and you lose about 90% of your vision due to blood splatter, how there's shotgun shells and ammo but no guns, etc. I could spent thousands of hours in this beautiful asset flip, but sadly due to a hard to pronounce name, I have to stop at a mere 24 minutes.

110182080.review:
Andarilho is easily the worst walking simulator ever:
-	Empty world
-	Barely any enemies
-	Animals don’t run away and barely move when you attack them
-	Arrows go through trees (magical arrows?)
-	The sound of your steps is incredibly weird: Who hears right and left steps in different ears? And especially in such an extreme way. It feels like your right foot is 5 meters to your right and the left foot 5 meters to your left
-	Did you know you can “open” lakes and grab 5 jars of water out of it? (I might have to reconsider if I am a magician or not – first the arrows, now this…)

I am letting the game run to get the trading cards, but it is not worth it.

81108468.review: More updates for this game please

121515128.review:
A small survival game with the ability to meet aliens and drive a BMW.

[b]Pros:[/b][list]
[*]+ Achievements
[*]+ Craft
[*]+ Zombies/Aliens
[*]+ Build your car
[*]+ BMW

[b]Minuses:[/b]
[*]- Limited map
[*]- Lean buildings[/list]

[b]Total:[/b]
A survivalist on a small map, with customizable opponents. You can choose to attack Zombies, or aliens - or both at once.
In addition to the standard life scale, the player receives thirst, fatigue, hunger. In this connection, you will have to not only build a house in which you can spend the darkest night in your life (even a torch cannot cope with darkness), but also hunt representatives of the animal world.
The game is pretty mediocre. Having created a house, you will not be able to somehow decorate or improve it - the game simply does not think of things for convenience.
But on the other hand, it is possible to create one (or several) cars and cut them around the map in pursuit of achievements.
I do not recommend this game for purchase, even for 50 cents.

90900026.review: Truly the worst "open world survival crafting" clone I've ever seen.

40438703.developer_response:
The game isn't broken, if you had any problem while playing, please use the community hub to let me know, I can't fix problems if I don't know they exists.

Edit 1: The game is playable and yes, there a few problems I'm working on, but, the game is not unplayable because of that. Also, you didn't played for at least 2 weeks, that means that you already lost 2 updates for the game and some of the those problem may be fixed already.

93999017.review: This is, quite simply, the best game ever made. 3/3, 5/5, 10/10, 100/100. The story was beautiful, something Shakespeare would die for. The characters are perfect (Geoff is absolute waifu material). The graphics are beautiful, I'm surprised you still have a perfect 120 FPS with them on Ultra. The cutscenes were like watching a movie, one filmed in 16k, that is. And don't even get me started on that twist ending. All around a 3/3, 5/5, 10/10, 100/100 experience, more than just a game.

35505994.review:
My friend was levelling up his steam account when he got a 90% off this game.

We looked at the screenshots and was taken back at how good it looked. 

He offered to buy it for me and I was like "sure, why not?".

After playing it for an hour it was honestly the best experience I have had. 

Me and my friend were both shocked at how well the game is, both performance wise and the game in general. The vehicles handle really well and the way the game works is really good for an early access game.

I see people saying they want multiplayer, don't get me wrong having a multiplayer would add to the wackiness but what me and my friend have been doing is calling each other either on discord or Skype and playing on our own and just enjoying the game.

Overall, I'd like to say that this is an amazing game to play. I have found some "glitches" of sorts but nothing that ruins the game just adds to how amazing it is. If you're bored and you have £0.72 I'd really recommend playing it. It does takes a bit of time to get it going but when you do it is amazing. 

There are things that could added or changed ect, but we need to all understand this is an early access game and need to accept that.

141371165.review: Andarilho presents an intriguing premise with its intricate plot and attention to visual detail, but it may not be everyone's cup of tea. The slow pace and heavy focus on exploration and storytelling could potentially feel boring to players looking for more dynamic gameplay. In addition, the game's complexity could cause some players to feel lost or frustrated, especially if they prefer a more straightforward gameplay experience. Although Andarilho offers a unique mix of elements, it might not quite suit the tastes of those who are looking for fast-paced or action-oriented gameplay.
